intro: Phymatodes ensiformis, commonly known as the arrowleaf phymatode, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Phymatodes ensiformis is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is an important component of desert ecosystems.
